emails.bodyHtml:
Company Policy Updates

Dear colleagues,

After reviewing feedback and benchmarking with industry peers, we are updating our remote-work and PTO policies effective December 1.

Highlights

  • Remote Work: Employees may work remotely up to 3 days per week with manager approval. Office days are encouraged for collaboration Tuesdays and Thursdays.
  • PTO accrual: Accrual increases after 2 years of service. See the attached matrix for details.
  • Parental leave: Expanded to 16 weeks paid leave for primary caregivers.

Please review the full policy document attached to this email and submit any questions to HR by November 25. We will host a live Q&A on Nov 27 at 3pm.

emails.subject: Ticket #12345 updated
emails.preview: Support update: we've identified the root cause and deployed a hotfix to staging.
emails.bodyHtml:
Ticket #12345 — Update

Hi,

Thanks for reporting this issue. Our investigation shows the problem was caused by a deadlock in the order processing worker when high concurrency and a specific payment provider response coincided.

What we did:

  1. Reproduced the issue in a staging environment using synthetic traffic.
  2. Implemented a fix to remove the deadlock by altering the retry lock logic and adding safer backoff.
  3. Deployed the fix to staging and executed a regression suite.

Current status: the fix is in staging and tests show the worker remains stable under load. We plan to deploy to production during the next maintenance window (Nov 18, 02:00 UTC) unless you advise otherwise.

If you can confirm the issue does not occur on your side after the deployment, we'll close the ticket. Thank you for your patience.
